data.title: Switch to 64-bit executables?
data.body:
Modern games and operating systems tend to be 64-bit only these days. How about we do that switch as well? My hope is that it will address issues like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/12494 as we gain more access to memory and maybe it will improve overall performance. Is that too naive? My technical knowledge in that regard is limited.

Porting should be easy. For the managed code just flip some switches and for the system calls we only need to update the bundled native Windows/Mac dependencies to their 64 bit counterparts and for Linux just update package architecture metadata.

I haven't checked how many players are still running 32-bit operating systems. Is that possible from our player survey? Hopefully no one will be excluded. My assumption or rather wishful thinking would be that most of them could upgrade to a 64-bit OS for their own benefit and 32-bit only era hardware will also make playing OpenRA especially the upcoming TS/RA2 mods not much fun anyway.

*current release

not sure if that is a bug or if it got removed intentionally

data.title: Reordering the list of units/structures in .yaml files
data.body: I find it odd that for example RA structures.yaml start with Missile Silo, or vehicle.yaml has V2 etc. I think we those are left at where they was added at first place and never changed. I think .yaml files should use the same order with `BuildPaletteOrder:`s of units, so it can be easier to find stuff when we look for.

D2K - Change tech level of Sardaukar to medium
data.body: They are counterpart of Grenadiers and Stealth Raiders and they both have `techlevel.medium`. I think this is left from the times where Sardaukar used to require Palace, which was wrong.

data.title: Allow disabling actor scans in CreateEffectWarhead
data.body:
The `CreateEffectWarhead` only needs to scan for actors to decide the `ImpactType`. In cases where the ImpactType doesn't matter (or where only the terrain matters), we can presumably save some performance during heated battles by not performing redundant scans for actors in the impact vicinity.

As example and test case, I'm applying this to the RA Flamer infantry weapon, because it fires a whopping 15 times per salvo, quickly adding up when many of them fire at the same time.

I didn't see a measurable difference, but that was to be expected as the SpreadDamageWH actor scan and projectile blocking scans are far more expensive and overshadow any tiny gains from this.

The impotant parts are that the warhead and lint rule changes work and the yaml change causes no regression.

Prerequisite for #12513.

data.title: D2K - Changed Give Unit Crate Powerups a bit
data.body:
I reordered the units, added Harvester, Thumper and Grenadier, added high_factory to side specific tanks' prerequisite and fixed Sardaukar's prerequisites. Also renamed @ part of Devastator and Deviator.

~~Note: Sardaukar in Infantry.yaml has tech level of High, not Medium. This is another thing that needs to be changed and i'll do in another PR.~~

data.title: Map Editor sidebar actor display space management.
data.body:
The current configuration of the map editor sorts all the actors on the mod on one list and displays them exactly as they look ingame, while this works well enough in the official mods, third party mods and second generation mods (that's the name for TS and RA2, correct?) are going to suffer from cluttered editor sidebars because actors can be extremely big, making the search for that specific actor you are looking for time consuming.

If possible, I would suggest to either add the option to rescale giant actors on the map editor sidebar, or allow the modder the option to set another sprite for each actor on the bar (which can be easily a downsized version of the sprite, or a generic image to differentiate all the stuff).

I add a small image to show what I am mean, the size of the structures is so big that the game only displays one structure per row, wasting a lot of space.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11763228/21960115/a3bd9488-dab4-11e6-9834-e6f8187182d7.png)

data.title: Master
RA. E3 damage values not working.
data.body:
Im not entirely sure how this can be fixed or if it should be fixed since this could cause a major strain on the balance right now and that there aren't any complaints on E3.

The damage values on the E3 vs armor types is incorrect and not taking effect from its main damage.

E3 base damage of 40.
None: 90
Wood: 75
Light: 60
Heavy: 25

11 shots vs Heavy Tank 440 damage. HP 550

6 shots vs APC 240 damage. HP 300

18 shots vs Mammoth Tank 720 damage. HP 900

9 shots vs Medium Tank 360 damage. HP 450

I haven't tested all the units but I have done things such as putting vs light value to 1 and attacking a V2. Made no change. Again, not sure how this can be done as it may effect balance greatly and people seem to be fine with how E3 damages work now.

SELF:

This is a reminder for me to look at both Primary and Secondary attributes rather then seeing Primary as the valid target ground. Kudos to FrameLimiter for pointing out my fail

data.title: Implement tunnels, elevated bridges, jumpjet and subterranean units.
data.body:
This PR introduces an `ICustomMovementLayer` interface and related plumbing that encode the idea of parallel movement/collision layers.  Mobile actors are able switch between these layers under implementation-defined conditions while moving.  This logic is then used for the core logic behind tunnels, jumpjets, and subterranean units.  An initial placeholder for elevated bridges is also included using a variation of tunnels combined with static prop actors.

The main priority here is the shared implementation and interaction with the pathfinder.  The TS features have their own sets of rough edges that I consider to be out of scope of this PR and can be improved on later.  I figure that this is a better approach than my usual long series of PRs to implement and polish everything in one pass.

data.title: Carryalls can still pick up unit after unit somehow changed owner (e.g. hijacking)
data.body:
Similar problem we had with engineers i guess, they were repairing enemy structures.

In my D2K mod i added a Hijacker unit for  Smugglers, i hijacked an enemy harvester when a carryall came to pick it up, but carryall still did that and put it to their refinery.

If owner of the waiting unit changes, carryall's order should be canceled.

data.title: Projectiles and warheads in shipping mods are unoptimized
data.body:
We leave quite a bit of mid-battle performance on the table due to larger-than-necessary victim/blocker scan radii on many warheads and blockable projectiles.

- All TD and D2k weapons, and at least some RA and TS weapons, don't need to have actor scans on their effect warheads at all, because the warhead triggers on all ImpactTypes anyway.

- All `SpreadDamage` warheads, and `CreateEffect` warheads that don't trigger on all ImpactTypes, only need to scan up to the largest hit shape (OuterRadius).

- All blockable projectiles only need a blocker scan radius large enough to find blocking actors, so at least in D2k, TD and RA, they only need something like 768 WDist or less (most outer corner of wall pieces), more than halving the cost of scanning for blockers compared to the default of 1536 WDist. Currently, 50 RA flamethrower infantry firing at the same time cost up to >10ms mostly due to `Blockable: true` on my i5-2500, things are certainly worse on slower CPUs.

So to improve performance, following measures can (or rather should) be taken:

- [x] Automatically use the largest Shape.OuterRadius as victim scan radius for warheads, bouncing bullets and area beams #13236

- [x] Automatically use the largest Shape.OuterRadius of an actor with `IBlocksProjectilesInfo` as scan radius for blockable projectiles #13236

- [ ] Skip victim scan entirely on all `CreateEffect` warheads that don't need to scan for actors

data.title: Implement experience multipliers.
data.body:
Requested by Crystallized Doom basically, but it was something I also wanted to add on my own anyway.

Implement two interfaces for experience multiplying both on giver (for things like increasing ranked-up actor's experience worth) and receiver side (for things like Generals's USA Advanced Training upgrade).

For a testcase, see http://resource.openra.net/maps/18262/.

data.body: And use it for TS disc grenade.

data.title: D2K - Both click repair and terrain damage are too low
data.body:
After D2K HP and Damage values are changed to original values, values for those stayed same and they are not quick enough.

I changed `RepairStep:` for `RepairableBuilding:` to 70 from 7 in my new D2K mod but it may be a bit much, some testing or math may be required to find a good value. I haven't touched to `DamagedByTerrain:` yet.

data.title: Idea:Multi-Language support
data.body:
OpenRA should support multi-language.
The core idea of Multi-Language support system is "localiztion string" which can be replaced by any other language.
There are some solutions:
UCS
UCS is a text format which contains "code" and "string", the code is the unique ID of the string, it can be any pure numbers, such as "160011"; The string is the localized string, for example, if we run OpenRA in English, the local string which ID is 160011 is "SinglePlayer", but if we run OpenRA in other language such as Chinese, it will be ".
UCS is quite simple to be processed, each UCS line is splited by "<TAB>", we just use split function to split each line of UCS file to get both ID and string.
we can use this code "160011" to stand for string "SinglePlayer" in English,  the only  thing translator need to do is translate the code "160011" to "SinglePlayer" in their language.

CSV
CSV is famous text format, it is splited by a "|", before the "|" is ID, after it is string.

data.title: Remove CanPowerDown from starports
data.body:
Starports are production facilities and the ability to toggle their power
status conflicts with the expected behaviour from other official OpenRA
mods.

Changelog suggestion: Removed the ability to manually power down
starports.

Related to #10402

data.title: Fixes Spy detection for Spies.
[IDEA] Air unit command queuing
data.body: I think it would be good to make queued commands work differently for air units, currently if you issue and attack command to air units, then queue commands to escape while avoiding AA fire, they will ignore the queued command until the target is destroyed, taking the straight line path to the nearest helipad or airstrip, (probably through the range circle of enemy AA), I think it would be better if the auto-reload was removed or optional, or if queued commands were executed either after the target is destroyed or ammo is depleted.

data.title: RedEye Minimum Range.
data.body: Fixes #12123

data.title: TD Aircraft Speeds.
data.body:
Balancing out some of the small things that makes a big difference with the aircraft. Listings below:

Chinook:

Mobile speed increased from 140 to 150.

This is increasing because a number of vehicles catch up to these. (Bikes, APCs, buggies, humvees.)

Increasing the movement of this unit will help to outrun the APCs and other projectiles a little quicker. It also helps to compensate for travel distances. These units are only used in early game because of the enemies lack of AA. Increasing the speed will help their longevity.


Apache mobile speed decreased from 186 to 180.

This is done to prevent these units from chase killing Orcas as their machinegun fire is on point hits with minimal damage. HP remains the same (Orca 90 Apache 125). Orca being lighter in HP allows it to move more quickly while the apache can soak more damage. In air vs air battles the apache tends to win due to their guns vs slow missile fire.


Both Orca and Apache turnspeed increased from 4 to 7.

This is increased on both units because they take a full second before they are able to aim at targets leaving them stationary and taking hits. Increasing this speeds allows them to be what they are ment to be as hit and strike crafts. The turning speed also allows them to hit targets more effectively on the move.

NOTES:

I am still testing the damages of the aircraft. Once the poll ends I will start testing more differences on the maps. So far some feedback has been obtained but need more data. Hearing and watching from many releases ago about buffing or nerfing these air units to much can tip the scales as far as being completely broken to completely worthless.
